pages.text: Making bronze is rather easy. By combining about 3 parts $(l:innovation/metallurgy/copper)copper$() to 1 part tin, melting them together in a $(l:innovation/burn/kiln)kiln$() at a relatively low melting point of around 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit will yield 4 bronze.

pages.title: Bronze Ingot
pages.text: This material is much more durable and ductile than the $(thing)copper$() used to make it, making its use for tools that much better. I also might also be able to make better parts because of its toughness.
